intro: Epilobium linnaeoides, commonly known as narrowleaf willow herb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows, stream banks, and marshes. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers in clusters. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Epilobium linnaeoides is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinators.
